item.title: Chapter 2 - Respond to Get and Set
item.description: In this chapter, we’ll build on the foundations we established in the previous chapter. We now know how to start a TCP server using the built-in TCPServer class. In this chapter we’ll build a basic client using another built-in class, TCPSocket. We’ll then make the server actually usable by making it respond to two commands, GET and SET.

item.title: Chapter 1 - A basic TCP server
item.description: This chapter will cover the creation of a TCP server in ruby, as well as how to interact with it with netcat (nc), a utility bundled with macOS. We will briefly look at concurrency and parallelism and how threads can impact the behavior of our server.
